population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on microorganisms in coconut water).
effective_dosage: Ultraviolet-C doses ranging from 0-40 mJ cm-2 (100 mJ cm-2 for MS2 bacteriophage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether coconut water could effectively inhibit browning and preserve the quality of fresh-cut green banana slices during storage compared to other treatments.
results_summary: Coconut water treatment outperformed lemon juice and normal water in maintaining visual appeal, firmness, and lower weight loss, while also retaining higher levels of total phenols, flavonoids, and antioxidant activity. It significantly suppressed polyphenol oxidase activity and kept microbial load within acceptable limits.
population_specificity: Fresh-cut green banana slices stored at 4±1°C.
effective_dosage: Immersion in coconut water (specific volume/frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an analytical method for detecting cadmium (Cd) and lead (Pb) levels in natural coconut water, industrialized coconut water, and coconut milk samples.
results_summary: The study found that Cd and Pb concentrations in all tested samples were below the maximum tolerated values set by Brazilian health authorities, indicating compliance with safety standards. The ranges varied by sample type, with natural coconut water showing higher variability in Pb levels.
population_specificity: Samples were collected in Salvador, Bahia (Brazil), but no specific human population was studied.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the protective effects of tender coconut water (TCW) against heat stress-induced testicular damage in rats and explore its mechanism of action.
results_summary: TCW restored antioxidant capacity, reduced lipid peroxidation, and reversed heat stress-induced inflammation in rat testicles by activating the Nrf2 antioxidant pathway and suppressing NF-κB-mediated pro-inflammation.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats exposed to acute heat stress.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of coconut water compared to milk and saline in preserving periodontal ligament (PDL) cell viability after tooth avulsion.
results_summary: Coconut water preserved significantly more viable PDL cells than milk and saline, demonstrating its superior efficacy as a storage medium for avulsed teeth. The results were statistically significant (P < 0.05).
population_specificity: Forty human premolars extracted for orthodontic purposes.
effective_dosage: Not specified (teeth stored in coconut water for 45 minutes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand how different processing methods (temperature and sulphite addition) affect the chemical composition of coconut water, particularly focusing on preventing pinking and maintaining organic compound levels.
results_summary: Coconut water processed at higher temperatures (136°C) with sulphite showed lower levels of sucrose and glucose, suggesting carbohydrate degradation, while lower-temperature processing without sulphite led to pink discoloration. Sulphite addition and high-temperature processing effectively prevented pinking and maintained organic compound levels.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on coconut water samples)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of ultrasound technology (US) for inactivating/sensitizing coconut water peroxidase (POD) and its potential as a pre-treatment to thermal processing.
results_summary: Ultrasound reduced enzyme activity by 27% after 30 minutes (286W/L, 20kHz) and sensitized the enzyme to subsequent thermal processing, leading to more uniform heat resistance. The study suggests US could reduce the need for prolonged high temperatures in conventional thermal processing.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on coconut water enzyme activity).
effective_dosage: 286W/L ultrasound intensity, 20kHz frequency, applied for 30 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of UV-C irradiation in inactivating pathogenic microorganisms and bacteriophages in coconut water while assessing its safety.
results_summary: UV-C irradiation effectively inactivated pathogenic bacteria and viruses in coconut water by >5 log10 at 30mJ·cm-2, with no cytotoxic effects observed on human intestinal and mouse liver cells. The inactivation kinetics followed a log-linear model with high statistical significance (p<0.05).
population_specificity: Microorganisms (bacteria and viruses) and in vitro human intestinal and mouse liver cells.
effective_dosage: UV-C doses ranging from 0-120mJ·cm-2, with 30mJ·cm-2 achieving >5 log10 reduction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the viability of Lactobacillus plantarum in a coconut water and oatmeal matrix, with and without added prebiotic (inulin), to determine shelf life and fermentation effects.
results_summary: The study found that the probiotic L. plantarum remained viable for seven weeks in the probiotic-only treatment and five weeks in the probiotic-prebiotic treatment, with a significant pH reduction but no significant change in viscosity.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: 7 log CFU/g of L. plantarum, 1 g inulin/100 mL (for PP treatment)
study_duration: 10 hours fermentation, followed by refrigerated storage (up to seven weeks)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if mature coconut water's antidiabetic and antithrombotic effects in diabetic rats are mediated through the L-arginine-nitric oxide pathway.
results_summary: Mature coconut water (MCW) and L-arginine reduced blood glucose, HbA1c, and exhibited antithrombotic effects in diabetic rats, including reduced WBC, platelets, fibrin, and fibrinogen levels. The benefits were linked to increased nitric oxide synthase activity and L-arginine content, which were inhibited by L-NAME.
population_specificity: Male Sprague-Dawley rats with alloxan-induced diabetes.
effective_dosage: MCW (4 mL/100 g body weight) and L-arginine (7.5 mg/100 g body weight) orally.
interactions: L-NAME inhibited the beneficial effects of MCW and L-arginine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of coconut water as a prophylactic agent against experimentally induced nephrolithiasis in a rat model.
results_summary: Coconut water inhibited crystal deposition in renal tissue, reduced urinary crystals, protected against impaired renal function, and mitigated oxidative stress in the kidneys. The results suggest potential benefits for urolithiasis prevention.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether coconut water concentrate (CWC) and its active component shikimic acid (SA) could protect murine hepatocytes from oxidative stress induced by hydrogen peroxide.
results_summary: CWC and SA significantly reduced oxidative damage in hepatocytes by lowering ROS levels, preventing DNA damage, and inhibiting apoptotic pathways, likely through activation of the PI3K/Akt/Nrf2 pathway and suppression of NF-κB.
population_specificity: Murine hepatocytes (mouse liver cells)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anticancer potential of Cn-AMP2, a peptide derived from green coconut water, specifically its anti-proliferative effects on human glioma cell lines.
results_summary: Cn-AMP2 demonstrated anti-proliferative activity against 1321N1 and U87MG human glioma cell lines with IC50 values of 1.25 and 1.85 mM, respectively. The peptide's mechanism involved membrane interaction via its N-terminal sequence and penetration of the membrane core by its hydrophobic C-terminal sequence, targeting intracellular components to inhibit cancer cell growth.
population_specificity: Human glioma cell lines (1321N1 and U87MG)
effective_dosage: IC50 values of 1.25 mM (1321N1) and 1.85 mM (U87MG)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate and compare the efficacy of coconut water, oral rehydration solution (ORS), and propolis in maintaining the viability of periodontal ligament (PDL) cells after tooth avulsion.
results_summary: The study found that coconut water demonstrated a significantly higher number of viable PDL cells compared to ORS and was comparable to propolis 50%. No significant difference was observed between coconut water and propolis 50%.
population_specificity: Teeth with intact crowns and healthy PDL, advised for orthodontic extraction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a powdered coconut water-based extender (ACP-116c) for cryopreservation of collared peccary semen.
results_summary: ACP-116c with 20% egg yolk and 3% glycerol preserved sperm motility and kinetic rating better than the Tris extender, though other sperm characteristics showed no significant differences. Computerized analysis confirmed superior preservation of total and progressive motility with this treatment.
population_specificity: Captive adult male collared peccaries.
effective_dosage: ACP-116c plus 20% egg yolk and 3% glycerol.

study_goal: To determine if tender coconut water (TCW) reduces oxidative stress and mitigates high blood pressure in fructose-fed hypertensive rats.
results_summary: TCW significantly lowered systolic blood pressure, reduced serum triglycerides, free fatty acids, plasma glucose, insulin levels, and lipid peroxidation markers while upregulating antioxidant enzymes and reducing liver lipid accumulation without hepatocellular damage.
population_specificity: Male Sprague Dawley rats fed a fructose-rich diet.
effective_dosage: 4 mL/100 g of body weight daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a rapid, precise method for determining chloride levels in liquid food samples, including coconut water.
results_summary: The study validated a reliable FIA-potentiometric system for chloride analysis in coconut water, showing high precision (R.S.D. of 1.2%) and rapid measurements (90 determinations/h). Results were consistent with capillary electrophoresis validation, with no significant differences at a 95% confidence level.
population_specificity: Not specified (food samples, not human subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of coconut water extender on post-thaw sperm quality in dog semen.
results_summary: The study found that coconut water extender was effective in preserving sperm quality, with no significant differences between the two dilution methods in terms of sperm motility, vigor, and normal spermatozoa. Both treatments were equally efficient.
population_specificity: Six dogs (12 ejaculates).
effective_dosage: Coconut water extender containing 20% egg yolk, with a final glycerol concentration of 6%.
study_duration: Semen was frozen for 1 week before evaluation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the electrolyte, sugar, calorie, osmolarity, and pH profiles of coconut water versus soft drinks for oral rehydration in diarrhoea patients.
results_summary: Coconut water had significantly higher electrolytes (especially potassium), lower osmolarity, less acidity, and lower sugar content compared to soft drinks, making it more easily absorbed. However, soft drinks provided more calories.
population_specificity: Patients with diarrhoea requiring oral rehydration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of plants, including coconut water, on tissue repair following tooth replantation by assessing their potential to maintain periodontal ligament cell viability.
results_summary: Coconut water was identified as one of the most common storage media for avulsed teeth, demonstrating potential effects on cell viability and proliferation, though methodological limitations were noted.
population_specificity: Studies focused on periodontal ligament cells in the context of dental avulsion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of tender coconut water (TCW) as a high-potassium drink on plasma potassium levels in prehypertensive women.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in plasma potassium levels between the TCW and control groups after 14 days, though both groups showed a non-significant tendency toward increased levels. The intervention did not conclusively increase plasma potassium levels in the studied population.
population_specificity: 32 prehypertensive women aged 25-44 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate coconut water as a potential storage medium for maintaining the viability of avulsed teeth.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that coconut water is being considered among various storage media for avulsed teeth, but it does not provide specific efficacy results. The focus is on its potential role in maintaining cell viability during tooth transport.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract discusses general dental practice scenarios).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of coconut water as a temporary storage medium for avulsed teeth compared to other solutions.
results_summary: The study reviewed multiple storage media, including coconut water, and found that while coconut water was among the evaluated options, pasteurized whole milk was the most frequently recommended due to its physiological compatibility and availability. Coconut water was not singled out as superior but was considered a viable natural alternative.
population_specificity: Not specified (laboratory studies and clinical reports on avulsed teeth storage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effect of solanesol (an intermediate in CoQ10 synthesis) against gentamicin-induced nephrotoxicity in rats.
results_summary: SNL (solanesol) reduced oxidative stress, inflammation, and kidney damage markers (creatinine, BUN, TBARS, TNF-α) while restoring glutathione levels and mitochondrial enzyme activity. Histological findings supported SNL's protective effects against nephrotoxicity.
population_specificity: Wistar albino rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the hypoglycemic and nephroprotective effects of coconut water in alloxan-induced diabetic rats.
results_summary: Coconut water maintained blood glucose levels, reduced HbA1c, and increased body weight in diabetic rats. It also showed potential in preventing hyperglycemia and oxidative stress caused by alloxan.
population_specificity: Alloxan-induced diabetic rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of CoQ10 supplementation in treating statin-induced myopathy.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation improved statin-associated myopathy in all included randomized controlled trials, with no notable side effects reported. The results suggest CoQ10 significantly alleviates musculoskeletal symptoms linked to statin use.
population_specificity: Adults with statin-associated myalgia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if Coenzyme Q10 could improve post-thaw sperm quality in dwarf surf clam by reducing oxidative stress during cryopreservation.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 (20 μM) significantly improved post-thaw sperm quality by reducing ROS production and lipid peroxidation while enhancing motility, membrane integrity, and enzyme activity, achieving larval rates similar to fresh controls. Other tested antioxidants showed no positive effects.
population_specificity: Dwarf surf clam (Mulinia lateralis) sperm
effective_dosage: 20 μM Coenzyme Q10 added to cryoprotective solution

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Coenzyme Q10 (alone or combined with vitamin E) could alleviate heat stress-induced anxiety, depression, and neuroinflammation in mice.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10, alone or with vitamin E, reduced anxiety and depressive behaviors, lowered serum corticosterone, and suppressed inflammatory markers (NF-κB, caspase 1, NLRP3, IL-1β) and hsp70 mRNA in the prefrontal cortex.
population_specificity: Male mice subjected to heat stress.
study_duration: 14 days of heat stress followed by 14 days of treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the therapeutic effects and mechanisms of Coenzyme Q10 in ischemic stroke, focusing on its neuroprotective properties.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 demonstrated neuroprotective effects in ischemic stroke through anti-oxidative stress, anti-nitrosative stress, anti-inflammation, and anti-cell death mechanisms, supported by in vitro, in vivo, and clinical evidence. The study highlighted its potential as a preventive and therapeutic candidate for ischemic stroke.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies, including in vitro, in vivo, and clinical observations).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective effects of Coenzyme Q10 (CQ10) against Aflatoxin B1-induced liver and kidney toxicity in rats.
results_summary: CQ10 significantly reduced liver and kidney damage markers, improved oxidative stress balance, and lowered inflammatory cytokines when used alone or in combination with alpha lipoic acid (ALA). Combined CQ10 and ALA treatment showed superior protective effects compared to either supplement alone.
population_specificity: Mature male Wistar Albino rats (180-200 g).
effective_dosage: 10 mg/kg body weight per day, administered by stomach gavage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review CoQ10's potential therapeutic roles in nerve regeneration and its neuroprotective effects in peripheral nerve injury-induced neurosensory disturbances.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation shows promise as a neuroprotective agent, potentially enhancing treatment efficacy for neurosensory disturbances by reducing oxidative stress and inflammation. Future studies are needed to optimize its use in nerve regeneration.
population_specificity: Patients with peripheral nerve injuries and neurosensory disturbances, including those with autoimmune diseases, diabetes mellitus, or chemical/perioperative nerve injuries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ubiquinol (CoQ10) could prevent relapse of thrombotic microangiopathy (TMA) in a child with COQ6 gene variants.
results_summary: The child remained relapse-free for 4 years after optimizing supportive therapies, including ubiquinol (50 mg/kg/day) and vitamins, following withdrawal of eculizumab. The elder sibling with the same genetic condition succumbed to TMA, suggesting potential efficacy of CoQ10 in this context.
population_specificity: A Chinese child with biallelic COQ6 variants presenting with familial thrombotic microangiopathy (TMA).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the protective potential of Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10) against Alzheimer's disease-related neural degeneration, focusing on its modulation of the BACE-1/GSK-3β pathway, and any synergistic effects when combined with donepezil.
results_summary: CoQ10 treatment improved memory, enhanced locomotion, and increased neuronal differentiation, primarily by inhibiting the BACE-1/GSK-3β pathway. These effects were supported by histological and immunohistological examinations of the hippocampus.
population_specificity: Male albino rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of Coenzyme Q10 in skin aging and the benefits of topical skincare products containing CoQ10.
results_summary: Topical CoQ10 replenishes cellular CoQ10 levels, improves energy homeostasis, and provides antioxidative effects, reducing signs of skin aging such as wrinkle depth. Ex vivo and in vivo studies showed increased CoQ10 levels in both superficial and deeper skin layers.
population_specificity: Not specified (general skin aging context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of CoQ10 pretreatment on IVF/ICSI outcomes in women with diminished ovarian reserve (DOR).
results_summary: CoQ10 pretreatment significantly improved clinical pregnancy rates, number of optimal embryos, oocytes retrieved, and E2 levels, while reducing cycle cancellation, miscarriage rates, and gonadotropin requirements. The pooled results were robust, though sample sizes were limited.
population_specificity: Women with diminished ovarian reserve (DOR) undergoing IVF/ICSI.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mutation mechanism in a high-yielding CoQ10 mutant strain (VK-2-3) and assess its impact on CoQ10 production.
results_summary: The study found that overexpression of the NAD gene increased CoQ10 titers by 16.00%, while silencing it decreased titers by 33.92%, revealing a significant role of the NAD gene in CoQ10 yield. The findings provide insights for genetic breeding and mechanistic analysis.
population_specificity: Mutant strain of R. sphaeroides (VK-2-3 and V-0).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Coenzyme Q10 supplementation on endothelial, vascular, and myocardial function in patients with Metabolic-dysfunction Associated Steatotic Liver Disease (MASLD).
results_summary: Six-month treatment with 240 mg/day of Coenzyme Q10 improved endothelial, vascular, and myocardial function, reduced liver steatosis, and enhanced micro- and macro-vasculature function compared to placebo, with statistically significant results.
population_specificity: Sixty patients with MASLD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Coenzyme Q10, combined with lisinopril, could improve hemodynamics and survival in a non-surgical treatment of ventricular septal rupture post-myocardial infarction.
results_summary: The study found that Coenzyme Q10, alongside lisinopril, stabilized hemodynamics after 3 months, suggesting improved energy production, tissue healing, and balanced remodeling, increasing survival in non-surgical cases.
population_specificity: A 74-year-old woman with late-onset acute myocardial infarction and ventricular septal rupture.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of adding CoQ10 to letrozole on sperm parameters and sex hormone levels in men with idiopathic oligoasthenoteratozoospermia (iOAT).
results_summary: CoQ10 combined with letrozole significantly improved sperm concentration, morphology, total count, motility, testosterone, and FSH levels while reducing estradiol. Most parameters showed greater improvement in the CoQ10 group compared to letrozole alone.
population_specificity: Iraqi men aged 18-60 with iOAT syndrome.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neuroprotective effects of Coenzyme Q10 against chemotherapy-induced cognitive impairment (CICI) caused by CAF treatment in mice.
results_summary: CoQ10 improved cognition, reduced oxidative stress and inflammation, enhanced mitochondrial function, and restored neuronal morphology in CAF-treated mice.
population_specificity: Swiss albino female mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of combining trimetazidine and CoQ10 versus CoQ10 alone in treating acute viral myocarditis (AVM).
results_summary: Combined treatment with trimetazidine and CoQ10 significantly improved overall therapy effectiveness, myocardial enzyme levels, and cardiac systolic function compared to CoQ10 alone, with no greater increase in adverse events.
population_specificity: Patients with acute viral myocarditis (AVM) (1,364 participants across 16 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether CoQ10 eyedrops, combined with vitamin E TPGS, could provide neuroprotective effects against diabetic-induced neurodegeneration in a type 2 diabetes mouse model.
results_summary: CoQ10 treatment preserved retinal neural cell function and histology, increased retinal layer thickness, reduced glial reactivity, and improved mitochondrial function compared to controls. The study demonstrated significant neuroprotective effects in diabetic retinopathy.
population_specificity: Type 2 diabetic mice (C57BLKsJ-db/db mice)

study_goal: To explore the neuroprotective effect of Coenzyme Q10 and its mechanism in alleviating depression-like behaviors in mice with chronic restraint stress.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 improved depression-like behaviors in CRS mice, reduced hippocampal GFAP loss, increased synaptic spines, and downregulated pyroptosis-related proteins (GSDMD-N, caspase-1, IL-1β). The effects were comparable to fluoxetine and VX765.
population_specificity: Mice subjected to chronic restraint stress (CRS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of CoQ10 supplementation on metabolic profiles, including insulin resistance and lipid profiles, in infertile women with PCOS who were candidates for IVF.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation significantly reduced blood insulin levels and insulin resistance while increasing PPAR-γ expression, but it had no significant impact on other metabolic profiles, GLUT-1, or LDLR expression.
population_specificity: Infertile women with PCOS (ages 18-40) who were candidates for IVF.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether CoQ10 treatment could ameliorate memory loss induced by nicotine-ethanol abstinence in rats.
results_summary: CoQ10 treatment prevented memory deficits and biochemical alterations (e.g., oxidative damage, inflammation, elevated amyloid-B levels) in rats undergoing nicotine-ethanol abstinence, with dose-dependent effects comparable to bupropion and naloxone co-administration.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats undergoing nicotine-ethanol abstinence.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether CoQ10 and its analog idebenone could mitigate ethanol-induced hepatotoxicity by inhibiting the NLRP3/caspase-1/IL-1β pathway.
results_summary: CoQ10 and idebenone reduced ethanol-induced hepatotoxicity markers, oxidative stress, and inflammatory pathway activation in a dose-dependent manner, with CoQ10 showing greater efficacy than idebenone.
population_specificity: Rats with ethanol-induced liver injury
effective_dosage: CoQ10 (10 or 20 mg/kg/day), idebenone (50 or 100 mg/kg/day)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Coenzyme Q10 (COQ-10) could prevent or reverse chlorpromazine (CPZ)-induced hematological impairments and oxidative/inflammatory damage in rats.
results_summary: COQ-10, alone or combined with taurine, effectively prevented and reversed CPZ-induced reductions in blood cell counts, oxidative stress markers, and inflammatory cytokines while improving antioxidant and anti-inflammatory status.
population_specificity: Male rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the neuroprotective effects and functional recovery potential of Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10) and ozone therapy in spinal cord injury (SCI).
results_summary: The study found that CoQ10, especially when combined with ozone therapy, significantly reduced oxidative stress (MDA) and apoptosis markers (caspase-3, Bax) while increasing antiapoptotic Bcl-2 levels, leading to improved histopathological, ultrastructural, and neurological outcomes in SCI rats.
population_specificity: Female Sprague-Dawley rats with induced spinal cord trauma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if Coenzyme Q10 could prevent retinal degeneration induced by oxidative stress (H2O2) in a porcine organ culture model.
results_summary: CoQ10 protected retinal ganglion cells (RGCs) from oxidative damage, reduced microglia activation, stimulated cellular protection genes (NRF2), and mitigated mitochondrial oxidative stress (SOD2).
population_specificity: Porcine retinal explants in an organ culture model.
study_duration: 48 hours of CoQ10 therapy following 3 hours of H2O2 exposure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of oral CoQ10 as an adjunctive treatment for reducing depression symptoms and improving oxidative stress and inflammation in patients with depression.
results_summary: The study found that 200 mg of CoQ10 daily for 8 weeks significantly reduced depression symptoms and improved oxidative stress markers (nitric oxide and total thiol groups) compared to placebo, but no significant changes were observed for interleukin 6, malondialdehyde, or total antioxidant capacity.
population_specificity: 69 patients with moderate to severe depression.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of CoQ10 on bile acid metabolism in mice on a high-fat diet and identify potential molecular targets.
results_summary: CoQ10 reversed the reduction in serum and colonic total bile acid levels caused by a high-fat diet and altered the bile acid profile. It showed high binding affinity to key targets like FXR and TGR5, suggesting a regulatory role in bile acid metabolism.
population_specificity: Mice on a high-fat diet

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of Coenzyme Q10 supplementation, alone and combined with exercise training, on cognitive impairment and cerebral infarction in aging rats with induced cerebral ischemia.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 alone improved spatial memory in the acquisition phase and passive avoidance memory in both acquisition and retention phases. When combined with exercise, it enhanced spatial memory retention and reduced cerebral infarction volume.
population_specificity: Aging male rats with induced middle cerebral artery occlusion (MCAO).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether early supplementation with CoQ10 could reduce severe oxygen-induced retinopathy (OIR) by modulating Notch signaling pathways.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation, alone or combined with fish oil, reversed retinal damage, oxidative stress, and Notch signaling imbalances caused by neonatal intermittent hypoxia. However, glutathione nanoparticles (nGSH) showed the most beneficial outcomes.
population_specificity: Newborn rats exposed to intermittent hypoxia during hyperoxia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether CoQ10 and dantrolene could mitigate simvastatin-induced myotoxicity and oxidative stress while preserving its antihyperlipidemic effects.
results_summary: The combination of CoQ10 and dantrolene normalized simvastatin-induced elevations in serum markers (ALT, AST, CK-MM) and tissue Ca2+ content, reduced oxidative stress, and inhibited TGF-β/Smad4 pathway activation without affecting statin efficacy.
population_specificity: Simvastatin-treated rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of CoQ10 in managing diabetes and its cardiovascular complications by examining its antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and metabolic regulatory effects.
results_summary: CoQ10 demonstrated significant potential in reducing oxidative stress, improving lipid profiles, and regulating blood pressure, with clinical trials supporting improved glycemic control and cardiovascular outcomes. Preclinical and clinical findings consistently highlighted its benefits in diabetes management.
population_specificity: Patients with diabetes mellitus and associated cardiovascular complications, as well as preclinical models (in vitro, in vivo, and mouse studies).
effective_dosage: 50, 100, 150, 200, and 300 mg per day (human studies); 10 and 20 μM (experimental); 10 mg/kg (mouse studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review Coenzyme Q10's physiological roles and its potential benefits in mitigating atherosclerosis-related processes, including oxidative stress, inflammation, and lipid metabolism.
results_summary: The study found that CoQ10 may decelerate atherosclerosis progression by improving lipid transport, reducing endothelial inflammation, and mitigating metabolic abnormalities, with synergistic effects when combined with other drugs.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals with or at risk of atherosclerotic disease (based on context, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the dose-dependent effects of Coenzyme Q10 supplementation on exercise-induced muscle damage, physical performance, and oxidative stress in adults.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation significantly reduced biomarkers of muscle damage (CK, LDH, Mb) and oxidative stress (MDA), with dose-dependent effects observed. No significant change in total antioxidant capacity was noted.
population_specificity: Adults (specific demographics not detailed, but predominantly Asian populations were studied).
effective_dosage: Dose-dependent effects were noted, with each 100 mg/day increase linked to biomarker reductions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether restoring mitochondrial function with Coenzyme Q10 could reverse the synthetic phenotype transformation in FBN1-knockdown smooth muscle cells, a model for Marfan syndrome.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 rapidly reversed the synthetic phenotype in FBN1-knockdown smooth muscle cells by restoring mitochondrial metabolism, improving TFAM levels, oxidative phosphorylation, and contractile marker expression.
population_specificity: Human smooth muscle cells with FBN1 knockdown (in vitro model for Marfan syndrome).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to critically assess and summarize the role of Coenzyme Q10 in cancer prevention and treatment, including its mechanisms and future research directions.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 demonstrates anticancer potential by reducing oxidative stress and may serve as an effective adjuvant therapy, though further standardization of its regimen is needed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficiency of different cell disruption methods for extracting protein and Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10) from purple non-sulfur bacteria (PNSB) biomass.
results_summary: Bead milling yielded the best protein extraction, while NaOH-assisted sonication achieved similar protein recovery with a better amino acid profile. EDTA was preferred for CoQ10 extraction, though its efficiency was suspected to be influenced by pH and temperature.
population_specificity: Purple non-sulfur bacteria (PNSB) biomass recovered from gas-to-liquid process water treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the anti-oxidant and anti-apoptotic effects of CoQ10 in protecting ovarian tissue from radiation-induced damage.
results_summary: Low-dose CoQ10 (30 mg/kg) showed radioprotective effects, preserving ovarian tissue structure and reducing necrosis and apoptosis, while high-dose (150 mg/kg) showed morphological protection but no antioxidative effect.
population_specificity: Female rats exposed to pelvic radiation.
effective_dosage: 30 mg/kg and 150 mg/kg, administered by oral gavage.
study_duration: 14 days (7 days pre-radiation and 7 days post-radiation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the prophylactic effects of Coenzyme Q10, both individually and in combination with Vitamin C, against inflammatory heart injury in a rat model of polymicrobial sepsis.
results_summary: CoQ10 significantly reduced oxidative stress, improved antioxidative parameters, lowered pro-inflammatory cytokines, and diminished cardiac tissue damage. In some evaluations, CoQ10 outperformed Vitamin C.
population_specificity: Adult female Sprague-Dawley rats with induced polymicrobial sepsis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether CoQ10 promotes early recovery of cardiac function and alleviates cardiac remodeling after myocardial infarction (MI), and whether it regulates macrophage-mediated pro-inflammatory responses post-MI.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation significantly improved cardiac function in MI patients post-PCI and reduced cardiac dysfunction, fibrosis, and hypertrophy in mice. It also suppressed pro-inflammatory macrophage recruitment and NLRP3/IL1β pathway activation.
population_specificity: MI patients (human study) and mice subjected to LAD ligation (animal study).
study_duration: Human follow-ups at 1 and 3 months post-PCI; animal study duration not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of CoQ10, particularly its bioavailability, efficacy in oxidative stress-related conditions, and the benefits of intravenous administration in emergency ischemic situations.
results_summary: The study found that CoQ10 effectively protects against oxidative damage and shows clinical efficacy when administered orally in high doses over extended periods. Intravenous administration rapidly increases CoQ10 concentration in tissues, offering cardio- and neuroprotective benefits in acute ischemic conditions.
population_specificity: Not specified (general oxidative stress-associated infectious and somatic diseases, with focus on ischemic conditions).
effective_dosage: High oral doses (specific amount not stated); intravenous administration (dosage not specified).
study_duration: Extended time periods (specific duration not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of kolaviron and Coenzyme Q10 on complex I activity, dopamine metabolism, glutamate clearance, and oxidative stress in rotenone-induced neurotoxicity in rats.
results_summary: Coenzyme Q10 pretreatment modulated complex I activity, improved redox balance, and enhanced dopamine metabolism by increasing tyrosine hydroxylase activity and decreasing monoamine oxidase activity. Its effects were comparable to kolaviron, suggesting potential therapeutic benefits for Parkinson's disease.
population_specificity: Adult male Wistar rats
study_duration: 7 days pretreatment followed by 48-hour rotenone administration

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of Coenzyme Q10 in different stages of chronic kidney disease (CKD) and correlate its levels with other biochemical parameters.
results_summary: The study found that Coenzyme Q10 levels were significantly reduced in CKD patients compared to healthy controls, with levels decreasing as CKD stages progressed. A positive correlation was observed between serum myeloperoxidase and Coenzyme Q10 in CKD patients.
population_specificity: 60 male CKD patients aged 25-50 years and 30 healthy male controls of the same age range.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether Coenzyme Q10 could modulate adipokines, diabetic cardiomyopathy, and hematological markers in diabetic rats.
results_summary: CoQ10 supplementation significantly reduced adipokines, cardiomyopathy markers, and glucose levels in diabetic rats, while improving hematological parameters.
population_specificity: Male rats with STZ-induced diabetes.
effective_dosage: 5 g of CoQ10 per kilogram of diet.
